formalText: She is feeling pretty proud of herself right now.
She woke up this morning and she  was really not doing well.
She slept 2 hours later than she meant to because when she wakes up,  she can't get up.
She feels she can't do this and then goes back to bed and sets her alarm for another half an hour.
She is sure James really likes that he's pretty good about it.
She couldn't get started.
She was wanting to hurt herself and was doing really bad.
She kind of sat there and thought well, my therapist would probably say that this was something about feeling this way sucks, but it's millier.
So it kind of comfort for her.
She thought well, it is comfortable in the sense that as long as she is incapacitated like this.
She doesn't have to actually solve the problem.
That was all I've been thinking about for the last couple of days.
She thought okay, and then she felt better.
Yeah, the problem is that she has basically a month of waiting because she has applied to all of the positions.

There aren't going to be very many positions being posted because most schools do their contract renewal somewhere around spring break or earlier like in February or early March and so they post new openings in February or March.

She had pretty much the same conversation with James once a week where she is so anxious that she is like well maybe she should just drop this all together and look at other fields. Maybe look for a different job altogether because James always tells her that if she takes a full-time job, she won't be able to teach next year.
She thinks her job for at least the next month is kind of to keep her anxiety under control.
That's kind of a full-time job.
Too bad.
She doesn't get paid for that.
She feels like she is getting better at it though.
The last couple of days it kept getting worse and worse.
Worse but she also kept feeling like she just needed something to snap her out of it and her wasn't able to find that.
Then, she suddenly felt better.
Now she just gets to be anxious hooray.
He was talking about anxiety and describing having a panic attack the other night.
She feels like her depression and anxiety just makes her worse person consistently.
She is certainly more selfish person
Maybe they're not trying to say that but that's what they end up saying by accident.
She doesn't really feel like this is doing her any good.
The implications of it pissed her off.
Partly because it sucks to be misunderstood and partly.
Sermons in general tend to piss her off to be honest.
She got a lot of complacent certainty.
It is difficult for her to
deal with even when she is not depressed.
It's always difficult for her to deal with.
Usually she is pretty comfortable being mad and critical at the sermons.
She has been kind of the skeptic in the feudal for a long time.
But on this topic, she is anxious about it.
She would really like this to mean something but she just doesn't think it does.
She feels like they talked a lot about how this works and how it happens. Also, the first kind of meeting what triggers it how it plays out.
She hears a lot of suffering will bring her closer to God and she hears a lot of suffering will help her be a better person understand other people better or be closer to other people.
She doesn't feel like either those are the case.
She feels like she just gets more and more alone and less and less capable of seeing anything outside of herself.
Particularly when the last couple of days there's nothing really new to say it's pretty much the same thing happening.
She feels like James gets frustrated with her about that or she worries about that.
She feels like well if her life sucks, at least it should suck a new way.
She talked to her sister on the phone yesterday and she was doing pretty badly.
She was having a good day.
She didn't want to go into too much detail about not doing well because then she startes crying on the phone and all of those things.
Where she was going with this is that from her when she is with somebody when she is suffering.
She can't think about the other person at all.
She can't enter the other person's life.
She can't talk about the things that the other person wants to talk about.
It's like she doesn't have anything to give that sucks.
She feels terrible about that.
They talked for a little bit and she told her all about what was going on with her and then there was just silence.
She told her what was going on and that she was having a bad day. That she was anxious about finding a job and haven't heard back from anywhere etcetera.
She is probably also thinking about suicide in a way that's a release.
There's any way it feels crummy and she is probably worried about staying in this really downward Jag after having felt better for a while and that sucks.
She always has these weird conversations.
She talks for 15 minutes about her dog.
It's like she is pretty good at keeping the focus off of herself and then feels kind of resentful about it, which doesn't help.
So she can either tell her what her life is actually like right now or in order to listen to her at all.
She sort of has to pretend that the rest of her life doesn't exist.
She has to pull out of it yesterday.
She is really close too, maybe it's too scary.
She guesses part of her is like she would rather be alone in this than having other people hurting like this.
But she also sort of wants other people to be
with her, so clearly part of her wants other people to feel like this and she feels bad about that.
Somehow it doesn't occur to her.
She is not that good of a storyteller.
She is not going to give this to other people by talking about it.
She slept 2 hours later than she meant to because when she wakes up, she feels like she can't get up.
She feels she can't do this and then goes back to bed and sets her alarm for another half an hour.
